title: Oddech jako podstawowy element  w procesie kształtowania dźwięku

abstracts.content: The essay addresses the fundamental aspect of a  skill set required to play musical instruments. The breathing process in playing woodand brasswind instruments is the main factor directly affecting the creation of sound. Discussing the topic of the breathing cycle in detail helps to better understand the whole pattern. The essay is divided into three parts. The first one includes information about the correct playing posture, which directly influences how our body works. The second one describes each phase of the breathing process such as inhaling, breath-holding and exhaling. Facts about the abdominal muscles and diaphragm function can also be found in this part, as well as its significant subsection on exhaling air into the instrument, the most important component of the entire breathing course among wind instrumentalists. The third part addresses correct breathing in the context of musical phrasing. Types of breathing during playing and the risks of an incorrect breathing technique, which might badly affect the meaning of phrasing, are also explored in this part. This essay aims to convey the essence of the correct breathing process throughout playing wind instruments, which is the major aspect to working on tone production.

title: Terapeutyczne wykorzystanie muzyki a poziom lęku nauczycieli w okresie pandemii – badanie pilotażowe

otherTitles.title: Therapeutic uses of music and anxiety level in teachers in times of pandemic – pilot study

abstracts.content: W czasie trwania pandemii COVID-19 odnotowano wzrost w zakresie doświadczanego lęku i stresu w wielu populacjach. W sposób szczególny dotknęły one wybranych grup zawodowych, w tym nauczycieli. Wśród strategii radzenia sobie z lękiem i stresem obiecujące rezultaty dają działania wykorzystujące muzykę jako narzędzie służące obniżeniu napięcia. Dla celów niniejszego badania skonstruowano protokół interwencji terapeutycznej wykorzystującej różne aktywności bazujące na muzyce. Przeprowadzono badanie pilotażowe, mające na celu z jednej strony wstępną ocenę skuteczności interwencji, z drugiej – sprawdzenie wykonalności proponowanego eksperymentu w wymiarze metodologicznym i praktycznym. W badaniu udział wzięło 13 uczestników (n=13); zastosowano mieszany schemat badania z trzykrotnie powtarzanym pomiarem (Kwestionariusz lęku uogólnionego GAD-7). Wyniki zinterpretowano zarówno w perspektywie indywidualizującej, jak i eksperymentalnej, z analizą statystyczną (ANOVA, test t-Studenta). Sugerują one, że autorska interwencja muzyczna przyczyniła się do zmniejszenia poziomu lęku w przebiegu czasowym. Ze względu na liczebność próby oraz pilotażowy charakter badania wyniki traktować należy z dużą dozą ostrożności.

During the COVID-19 pandemic, there has been an increase in anxiety and distress in many populations. They particularly affected selected professional groups, e.g. teachers. Among the strategies for coping with anxiety and stress, interventions using music as a tool to reduce tension are showing promising results. For the purpose of this study, a therapeutic intervention protocol using various music-based activities was constructed. A pilot study was carried out to initially assess the effectiveness of the intervention, and – on the other hand – to check the feasibility of the proposed experiment in terms of methodology and practice. The study involved 13 participants (n = 13); a mixed study design with a triple-repeated measures was used (the GAD-7 Generalized Anxiety Questionnaire). The results were interpreted both in an individualized and experimental perspective, with a statistical analysis (ANOVA, Student’s t-test). They suggest that the original musical intervention contributed to the reduction of the level of anxiety in the time course. Due to the size of the sample and the pilot design of the study, the results should be treated with caution.

otherTitles.title: The meaning of silence in music therapy

abstracts.content: Celem artykułu jest próba opisania złożonego zjawiska, jakim jest cisza, ze szczególnym uwzględnieniem jej znaczenia w kontekście muzykoterapii. Autorka skupia się na podkreśleniu wielowymiarowości tematu, przedstawiając różne definicje i postawy wobec fenomenu ciszy w obrębie komunikacji interpersonalnej i szeroko rozumianej przestrzeni dźwiękowej. Omówiona zostaje różnica między ciszą a milczeniem, podkreślony jest także interdyscyplinarny charakter problematyki. Autorka wymienia obszary, w których zjawisko może być rozpatrywane, a następnie szerzej przygląda się ciszy w obrębie dziedzin mających związek z oddziaływaniem terapeutycznym, w tym: psychoterapii i muzykoterapii. W przedstawionych przypadkach pracy muzykoterapeutycznej cisza stanowi rodzaj narzędzia pracy terapeuty. Zaprezentowane zostają również wypowiedzi muzykoterapeutów na temat ich własnych doświadczeń związanych z ciszą podczas sesji muzykoterapeutycznych. Niewielka liczba badań dotyczących ciszy w muzykoterapii stanowi powód, dla którego niemożliwe jest przedstawienie przełomowych wniosków w tym obszarze. Artykuł stanowi próbę podsumowania aktualnych danych, podkreśla potrzebę szerszego przyjrzenia się problematyce oraz ma na celu wskazanie muzykoterapeutycznych potencjałów tkwiących w niejednoznacznie brzmiącym pojęciu ciszy.

In this paper, the author attempts to provide a comprehensive description of the complex phenomenon of silence and sheds light on its significance within the context of music therapy. By considering various definitions of silence, as well as ways of approaching the phenomenon of silence, in both the domain of interpersonal communication and the abundant realm of sound, the author aims to highlight the multifaceted nature of the matter. The author discusses the distinction between the silence and the muteness, draws attention to an interdisciplinary character of the field, enumerates diverse angles of considering the issue, and examines the role of silence within a larger perspective of fields of psychotherapy and music therapy. In the presented cases of music therapy work, silence is a kind of a therapist’s tool. Owing to an insufficient amount of research papers on silence in music therapy, it is impossible to produce pioneering findings in the very field. In this paper the author ventures to summarise latest data, points out the urgency of delving deeper into the issue, and discloses novel prospects for music therapy to be discovered in pursuit of investigation of the ambiguous notion of silence.

title: Głos basowy jako (nie)zmienna podstawa  improwizacyjnej realizacji basso continuo

otherTitles.title: The Bass Line: An (In)Alterable Basis for  Improvised Basso Continuo Realization

abstracts.content:
In the Baroque repertoire, the bass line appears to be a flexible instrument dependent 
on the artist’s creativity.
The author proves this assumption by presenting examples of pieces in which 
bass-line diminution was written by composers themselves. She also relies on source 
texts treating the issues of accompaniment realization based on figured bass.
Examples of bass diminution may be found in the works of Italian composers 
(Francesco Gasparini, Dario Castello), as well as French (Saint Lambert, Jean-Féry 
Rebel, Jean-Henri d’Anglebert, Michel Corrette, Marin Marais, Denis Delair, Nicolas 
Fleury) and German artists (Friedrich Erhard Niedt, Johann David Heinichen, Christoph Schaffrath).
The author’s considerations are preceded by a description of the beginnings of 
the basso continuo practice in Italy which subsequently spread throughout Baroque 
Europe.

title: Notacja muzyczna Karola Szymanowskiego – dylematy wykonawcy

otherTitles.title: Karol Szymanowski’s Music Notation: The Performer’s Dilemmas

abstracts.content: As the introduction to the complete edition of the piano works of Karol Szymanowski printed by PWM (Kraków 1982) reads, ‘its purpose is the presentation in a form fully consistent with the composer’s intention’. However, it also reads that ‘to render the musical text clear and legible, some directions for performance and signs have been made uniform or removed. Szymanowski often marked the dynamics by both a sign and verbal indications, for instance <, cresc., in which case only one has been retained. Most of the brackets found in the autograph have been removed without any reference being made in the Editorial Notes’. The article points out the inaccuracies in understanding the dynamics and expression marks in Szymanowski’s early piano music. The author’s research into autographs and first editions proves that both, the dynamic and expression marks, are multilayer as is the complex texture of the composer’s pieces.

title: Instrument totalny i ujarzmiony: utwory na fortepian solo i w zespole kameralnym Andrzeja Krzanowskiego

otherTitles.title: A Total and Tamed Instrument: Works for Piano in Solo Chamber Ensemble Settings by Andrzej Krzanowski

abstracts.content: Andrzej Krzanowski is known as an accordion music composer, dramatic and musical work visionary and a master of string quartets. Little is known, however, about his piano music, either solo or chamber. The aim of this presentation is to recognize a small but interesting piano contribution of this composer. It includes the early compositions MJ71 (1971) for instrumental ensemble and Mosaic (1971) for tuba solo and piano, and the much later Piano Miniatures (1984/87). These works are written for an instrument perceived differently by the composer: the early ones is for the total piano which sonoristic qualities have been extended by performing actions involving the performer in a special way, and additional props. The thumbnails show a different side of this creator. The composition mainly follows a more traditional approach to both the elements of the work and shaping the form. The speech will describe both the musical means used by Krzanowski, and selected formal and analytical aspect of the aforementioned compositions.

otherTitles.title: The Life and Work of Edwin Kowalik (1928–1997)

abstracts.content: On 20 May 2022, 25 years have passed since the death of Edwin Kowalik. This anniversary is the perfect moment to remind the Polish music community of this great pianist, composer and community arts worker. Edwin Kowalik was born in 1928 in Chropaczów (today a district of Świętochłowice) who completely lost his eyesight in his childhood. However, at the music school in Laski (today named after the pianist), his extraordinary musical talents were discovered: eventually, Edwin Kowalik graduated from the Academy of Music in Łódź (he studied with Władysław Kędra and Maria Wiłkomirska). His performance was acclaimed in numerous competitions, including the 5th edition of Fryderyk Chopin International Piano Competition (honourable mention) and the International Piano Competition in Rio de Janeiro (1957, country representative, sixth prize). In addition to frequent concert performances in Poland and abroad, Kowalik worked as an editor and publisher of Braille notes in the Polish Association of the Blind, and together with the Fryderyk Chopin Society led to the publication of ‘Complete Works’ of Fryderyk Chopin and ‘Selected Works’ of Karol Szymanowski using the Braille system. Kowalik also found fulfilment in being the editor of Magazyn Muzyczny which he founded, writing poetry and composing, mainly short pieces for piano and simple song forms. So far, two documentaries, albeit not widely available, and one feature-reminiscence have appeared about the life and activities of Kowalik. This article is aimed at presenting the most important biographical information about Edwin Kowalik and his artistic ideas.

title: Ilustracjonizm i symbolizm w muzyce fortepianowej Sergiusza Rachmaninowa w kontekście tworzenia własnej koncepcji interpretacyjnej. Analiza zagadnienia na przykładzie wybranych Études-Tableaux

otherTitles.title: Illustrationism and Symbolism in Sergei Rachmaninoff’s Piano Music in the Context of Creating Own Interpretative Concept. An Analysis of the Issue in Selected Études-Tableaux

abstracts.content: Both cycles of Études-Tableaux (opuses 33 and 39, composed between 1911 and 1917 in Russia), piano poems combining virtuosity and elements of sound painting represent the mature period in the works by Sergei Rachmaninoff (1873–1943) – a pianist, composer and conductor – regarded as one of the most prominent figures of the Golden Age of the Piano, follower of Chopinian and Lisztian tradition which he extended by enhancing expressiveness, which resulted in the creation of an interesting piano texture. As an invaluable contribution to the solo piano literature, Études-Tableaux demonstrate the full tonal capabilities of the instrument, and their illustrative idiom coexisting with the symbolistic element opens up endless possibilities of artistic creation. Their distinguishing feature is the extramusical dimension along with obvious influences of Orthodox Church music and Russian folk music, a multitude of fascinating borrowings from the field of painting and musical metaphors. An integral component of developing one’s own interpretative concept involves an analysis of the narrative of Études-Tableaux in terms of symbolism as an ideological link to the full expression that affects their unique poetics. A few Études have been explored in order to identify the sources of inspirations, extramusical analogies, comparative elements and stylistic reminiscences that refer to the creativity of composers highly regarded by Rachmaninoff. The conveyance of hidden meanings shall be done through the composer’s complex musical rhetoric introducing the artistic anxiety that inspires a constant search for musical meanings. The process of interpretation becomes a meta-journey leading deeper into the fascinating world of Rachmaninovian symbolism, extending the scope of imagination with parallels from the borderland between literature and painting of Russian (Lermontov, Vrubel, Levitan, Kustodiev) and European (Perrault, Böcklin) art.
